snippet.title: Brain BREAKs for Kids 🎮 Virtual Learning 🎮 2020 🎮 Fortnite Follow
snippet.description:
Need to move? Take a quick Brain BREAK and dance to "Fortnite Follow", if your a fan, you will definitely see some familiar moves from the game. This is a fun way for you to get up and learn a new dance. Whether you've been at your computer or desk too long, take a BREAK because, Breaks, Reset, Engagement, Attention and Knowledge!  

Sign up for ALL of our FREE Brian BREAKs here: https://bit.ly/BREAKDance20-21

snippet.title: If a Kangaroo Can Jump | Kids Song |Music and Movement | Brain Break
snippet.description:
Join Mimi, Gabi-Roo and friends for this music and movement song that teaches kids that they can try and do new things. A great song for a brain break in the classroom or at home. 

Song Lyrics

If a kangaroo can jump then you can too

Verse 1

Follow me along
See if you can do
All the sounds and movements 
That you might see in a zoo
You might be surprised
At how easy it can be
To imitate the animals
In this menagerie


Chorus

Soar as high as an eagle
Squawk like an Aussie cockatoo
Hang out like a sloth
Or waddle like a duck
If a kangaroo can jump then you can too


Verse 2

It’s not very hard
To copy what you see
To hop and stomp and crawl or swim 
Like creatures in the sea
Or talk to the animals
With a ‘woof’ or ‘quack’ or ‘moo’
Or growl and roar at dinner time
Like lions in the zoo

Chorus

Swing and scratch like a monkey
Snort and prance like gnu
Gallop like a zebra
Or slink like a fox
If a kangaroo can jump then you can too

If a kangaroo can jump then you can too!

We invite you to like, subscribe and share our videos with your friends!

snippet.title: Yoga for Kids: Brain Break 1: standing poses
snippet.description:
In this yoga video can be used as a brain break in your classroom or during remote learning. The poses featured in this video are standing poses that kids can do in the class standing in front of their chair or at home standing in front of their learning device. 

Brain breaks are important during learning because kids needs to move their bodies in order to stay focused on their learning.

snippet.title: Animals in Action! Best Brain Break and Body Movement Song for Kids
snippet.description:
Let's try to move like the animals! This movement song is a great brain break for preschoolers and toddlers. Children can listen to animal sounds and try to move like their favorite creatures!

Lyrics:
I am an animal,
you are an animal,
We are all animals,
Let's have some fun!

Stomp like an elephant. Stomp! Stomp! Stomp!
Stomp like an elephant. Stomp! Stomp! Stomp!
Stomp your feet, to the beat. Stomp! Stomp! Stomp!
Stomp! Stomp! Stomp!
Stomping is fun!

I am an animal,
you are an animal,
We are all animals,
Let's have some fun!

Swing your arms like a monkey. Swing! Swing! Swing!
Swing your arms like a monkey. Swing! Swing! Swing!
Swing your arms, swing them well
Swings your arms and yell! Oo-oo-oo!
Swing! Swing! Swing!
Swinging is fun.

I am an animal,
you are an animal,
We are all animals,
Let's have some fun!

Run around like a cheetah. Run! Run! Run!
Run around like a cheetah. Run! Run! Run!
Run around, really fast! Watch out! Don't be last! 
Run! Run! Run!
Running is fun

I am an animal,
you are an animal,
We are all animals,
Let's have some fun!

Fly like a bird. Fly! Fly! Fly!
Fly like a bird. Fly! Fly! Fly!
Flap your wings so you can fly,
Fly up high, in the sky! 
Fly! Fly! Fly!
Flying is fun!

I am an animal,
you are an animal,
We are all animals,
Let's have some fun!

Walk like a penguin. Walk! Walk! Walk!
Walk like a penguin. Walk! Walk! Walk!
Walk very slowly, with your wings by your sides.
Walk! Walk! Walk! 
Walking is fun

I am an animal,
you are an animal,
We are all animals,
Let's have some fun!

Stomp! Stomp! Stomp!
Swing! Swing! Swing!
Run! Run! Run!
Fly! Fly! Fly!
Walk! Walk! Walk!

I am an animal,
you are an animal,
We are all animals,
Let's have some fun!

I am an animal,
you are an animal,
We are all animals,
Let's have some fun!

Thanks for watching Animals in Action!

snippet.title: Mindful Activity for Kids | Fun Mindfulness | Brain Break for Children
snippet.description:
This video helps kids learn how to release physical and emotional tension. We play a game where they make their bodies really tight, squeezing all of their muscles and then relax all of their muscles as much as possible. Games like this help to regulate kids' emotions through mindfulness exercises.  Follow along here on our guided mindfulness activity and you'll start learning a lifelong habit that has tremendous health benefits. Did you know that meditating for at least 10 mins a day helps achieve a happier mindset? Remember that learning any skill takes practice. Try to do at least one mindfulness exercise each day. 

Try another mindfulness activity:
https://youtu.be/lnAx_Dr_CfA

Want to get some exercise? Try a fun cardio and strength routine:
https://youtu.be/oj-iqwuHCHM

Ready to have some fun? Dance it out with Bond! 
https://youtu.be/FOwN3MLP3Yc

snippet.title: Good Morning Song | Morning Call and Response for Kids | Circle Time | Brain Breaks for Children
snippet.description:
This Good Morning Song is a fun, interactive video to help pre K-grade 5 students energized & ready to start their day.  I had so much fun creating this fun, good morning/welcome song to help kids learn! And a bonus...it’s also a great call and response song.

Let me know what you and your students think!

Speaking of good morning songs, what songs or routines do you do in the morning to get ready for learning? Any creative ideas? Any early thoughts about how you’ll celebrate in this virtual environment?

**I wrote the lyrics and produced the music for this video. For those of you I haven’t yet had the pleasure of meeting, I’m a K-5 early childhood education teacher with a passion for educating children and using the power of music to help children learn and excel.

I publish new videos every week, so be sure to like and SUBSCRIBE to my YouTube channel for more fun videos to help your K-5 students/kids learn.

#goodmorningsong #welcomesongsforchildren #brainbreaksforkids

LYRICS:
I’ve got the feeling that today is a special day and we need to CELEBRATE!

Now it’s time to celebrate, to celebrate
Now it’s time to celebrate, to celebrate

Y’all, that is so great, let's not wait let's celebrate
Undulate, move your vertebrate
Party activate! Be a good time advocate!
Move your body as we celebrate and...
Animate, congregate, culminate, demonstrate
Dance on down to the Bering Strait
But there’s one thing left to extrapolate
so come on party people let me hear you say it!

WHAT ARE WE CELEBRATING?
(shout it out loud)
WHAT ARE WE CELEBRATING?

(That’s right!)
Now it’s time to celebrate, to celebrate
(Woo, it feels good to celebrate!)
Now it’s time to celebrate, to celebrate

Don't premeditate or procrastinate, 
Let's appreciate, let's celebrate
Undulate, move your vertebrates
Strut the runway like a fashion plate

Let’s see…
Navigate, percolate, propagate, save the date,
Syncopate, tabulate, tolerate, celebrate!

Educate, elevate, instigate, motivate, 
Today’s the date to celebrate, it feels so great to ask y’all…
WHAT ARE WE CELEBRATING?
(shout it out loud)
WHAT ARE WE CELEBRATING?

Go Class! Go Class! Go Class! 
Go Class! Go Class! Go Class! 

Oh yeah! You are celebrating with Blazer Fresh! Get up out of your seats and dance with us! Celebrate! Celebrate! Celebrate!

WHAT ARE WE CELEBRATING?
(shout it out loud)
WHAT ARE WE CELEBRATING?
WHAT ARE WE CELEBRATING?
(shout it out loud)
WHAT ARE WE CELEBRATING?

There’s so much to celebrate! Can’t stop me, baby!

snippet.title: Four Spot Exercise Twister Challenge | Brain Break Workout Fun | Kids & Family Fitness
snippet.description:
How fast are you? Great kid, student and family workout fun. Great for a quick brain break for kids. Pe At Home challenge is to perform exercises at the correct number from 1 to 4.  Create a grid 4 x 4. If you have the space make the grid bigger for a added challenge or smaller for K-2 to make it less challenging.
1. Jumping Jacks
2. Ski Jumps
3. Quick Feet
4. Silly dance but safe dance movements

*Please check that the playing area is safe for movements. Have an adult supervise you!*
If the speed round is too fast for you, go to settings on the videos and slow down the speed. To easy, speed up the video.

snippet.title: Spelling for Kids - Mr. B's Brain - Ep. 5: Stretching, Breaking, and Sounding Out Words
snippet.description:
Spelling for Kids shows how to stretch and break words, and pick the proper vowel sound.

Other Mr. B's Brain Videos:
Subtraction Magic: https://youtu.be/96kDx-yw3f0
Phonics Reading: https://youtu.be/tpLKilWB3mw
Addition Gameshow: https://youtu.be/BIu3QBSn0ig
2D vs. 3D Shapes: https://youtu.be/YxoLlSTu1jo
Addition Song: https://youtu.be/v6cMscvg3TE

Please like, share, and subscribe!  
Follow us on Instagram: @mr._bs_brain
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/MrBs-Brain-978358632371933/
https://www.mrbsbrain.com/

Mr. B's Brain shows that sounding out words is systematic: stretch the word slowly, break it into its component chunks, listen closely for the vowel sound, and finally write what you hear.

For most children, some time around preschool, kindergarten, or first grade they start to see words not as whole units, but small chunks that come together to form words.   Sure worksheet practice is part of the process, but our video will bring another part to that: fun visuals and examples to help children see the pattern to spelling.  That way they will be ready for the spelling test!  We use fun, fancy clipart to bring together our electronic program.  It's for the beginner, early primary grade spellers, typically a 6 year old or under.  And remember, early spelling is not always about being correct, but listening for the acceptable sounds they hear (e.g. "bat" might be "bt" "bet" or even just "b").  The words you select should be a challenge level of medium without frustration, and practice throughout the week as you would any skill you want to improve.  If the child is having trouble hearing sounds in words, switch to a visual style as that might be a stronger way of processing for that particular kid.

Our goal at Mr. B's Brain is to use YouTube as an enrichment for school.  We aim to help each student with animated learning opportunities.  We have gotten feedback that our lessons are effective for the toddler all the way to the adult - as it helps moms and dads learn how to teach their students in better ways.  We've done a patient search of video Youtube content, surveyed teachers, looked at what was effective in the classroom, analyzed lesson plans, and then came to create what you see before you.  We are proud of our free high resolution short videos that are a great tool to join with a traditional education.  You have our permission to use them in your home, preschool, kindergarten class, first grade classroom, or anywhere else you'd like to.  Thanks for your support, enjoy!

The Floor is Lava song lyrics for kids :

Let's play The Floor is Lava Game!
When I say, "The floor is lava!"
Get  off the floor!
And when I say, "Dance!"
Dance!!!

All the creatures dance

Dancing, dancing on the floor,     
Dancing, dancing, dancing,
Dancing, just a little bit more,

Mr. Greenblob:
But jump when I say…..

Robot Buddy: (a digital readout screen appears on his chest)
5!
4!
3!
2!
1!

THE FLOOR IS LAVA!!!!

Suddenly, the floor turns to lava!

THE FLOOR IS LAVA!!!!

snippet.title: Animals in Action! Brain Break and Body Movement Song for Kids
snippet.description:
Let's try to move like the animals! This movement song is a great brain break for preschoolers and toddlers. Children can listen to animal sounds and try to move like their favorite creatures!

Lyrics:
I am an animal,
you are an animal,
We are all animals,
Let's have some fun!

Stomp like an elephant. Stomp! Stomp! Stomp!
Stomp like an elephant. Stomp! Stomp! Stomp!
Stomp your feet, to the beat. Stomp! Stomp! Stomp!
Stomp! Stomp! Stomp!
Stomping is fun!

I am an animal,
you are an animal,
We are all animals,
Let's have some fun!

Swing your arms like a monkey. Swing! Swing! Swing!
Swing your arms like a monkey. Swing! Swing! Swing!
Swing your arms, swing them well
Swings your arms and yell! Oo-oo-oo!
Swing! Swing! Swing!
Swinging is fun.

I am an animal,
you are an animal,
We are all animals,
Let's have some fun!

Run around like a cheetah. Run! Run! Run!
Run around like a cheetah. Run! Run! Run!
Run around, really fast! Watch out! Don't be last! 
Run! Run! Run!
Running is fun

I am an animal,
you are an animal,
We are all animals,
Let's have some fun!

Fly like a bird. Fly! Fly! Fly!
Fly like a bird. Fly! Fly! Fly!
Flap your wings so you can fly,
Fly up high, in the sky! 
Fly! Fly! Fly!
Flying is fun!

I am an animal,
you are an animal,
We are all animals,
Let's have some fun!

Walk like a penguin. Walk! Walk! Walk!
Walk like a penguin. Walk! Walk! Walk!
Walk very slowly, with your wings by your sides.
Walk! Walk! Walk! 
Walking is fun

I am an animal,
you are an animal,
We are all animals,
Let's have some fun!

Stomp! Stomp! Stomp!
Swing! Swing! Swing!
Run! Run! Run!
Fly! Fly! Fly!
Walk! Walk! Walk!

I am an animal,
you are an animal,
We are all animals,
Let's have some fun!

I am an animal,
you are an animal,
We are all animals,
Let's have some fun!

Thanks for watching Animals in Action!

snippet.title: Monster Disco Dance Fitness, Exercise, Physical Education, PE, Brain Break, Active Kids, Movement
snippet.description:
Get your Fitness Tracker Here!! https://www.teacherspayteachers.com/Product/Exercise-Journal-Weekly-Fitness-Tracker-Physical-Literacy-5902877

Get your students moving with the Monster Disco Dance!!

3 Minutes

Health and physical education offers students a unique opportunity for kinesthetic learning – they learn about healthy, active living primarily by “doing”, that is, through physical activity. In health and physical education, students discover the joy of movement, learn about their bodies, and develop physical and cognitive skills that will contribute to their lifelong health and well-being.

snippet.title: Online Kids Class #49 ♫ Haunted House "LIVE" & Halloween Songs For Kids ♫ by The Learning Station
snippet.description:
Online Class #49: Welcome to The Learning Station online/virtual class #48 for children. Online Kids Class #48 will include: ♫ Music and movement and learning for preschoolers by The Learning Station (Also, known as Learning Station). Here is a list of the educational action, movement, brain breaks and fun learning Halloween songs we will be performing today: 
❤ Haunted House "LIVE" (Fun brain break adventure)
❤ Wild Things (Literacy tie-in, costumes and a brain break)
❤ Stirring Our Brew (Cute monsters performing this fun brain break)
❤ Five Little Pumpkins (Count to five Halloween song)

Visit our website where you can find all of these songs available on a CD or in single song downloads. https://www.learningstationmusic.com/shop/

Haunted House Halloween Songs for Kids: Your children will love our scary Halloween freeze dance for kids. Children explore a Halloween haunted house with a friendly dancing goblin, skeleton, werewolf and vampire.  This scary Halloween song is ideal for preschoolers, kindergarten & elementary children. Also, this Halloween dance song is perfect for school assemblies, family nights, children’s performances and kids Halloween parties. This is a fun freeze dance that children love!

♫ Haunted House  (Halloween song & freeze dance for children & kids)                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     by The Learning Station
℗©Monopoli/The Learning Station
★ Lyrics
We tip toed through the haunted house and what did we see? 
A ghostly, ghoulish goblin waving cheerfully. 
He wiggled and he wobbled and he winked his eye
And then we started dancing much to our surprise.
We started mashing, toe tapping, we touched our toes and knees.
And then he growled RAAAW! And then he howled OOOOH. 
And he hopped and shouted FREEZE!
Tip toe, tip toe through the haunted house we go.
Tip toe, tip toe through the haunted house we go.

We tip toed through the haunted house and what did we see? 
A silly, spooky skeleton waving cheerfully. 
 He wiggled and he wobbled and he winked his eye
And then we started dancing much to our surprise.
We started mashing, toe tapping, we touched our toes and knees.
And then he growled RAAAW! And then he howled OOOOH. 
And he hopped and shouted FREEZE!
Tip toe, tip toe through the haunted house we go.
Tip toe, tip toe through the haunted house we go.

We tip toed through the haunted house and what did we see? 
A wild, wacky werewolf waving cheerfully. 
 He wiggled and he wobbled and he winked his eye
And then we started dancing much to our surprise.
We started mashing, toe tapping, we touched our toes and knees.
And then he growled RAAAW! And then he howled OOOOH. 
And he hopped and shouted FREEZE!
Tip toe, tip toe through the haunted house we go.
Tip toe, tip toe through the haunted house we go.

We tip toed through the haunted house and what did we see? 
A very vain vampire waving cheerfully. 
 He wiggled and he wobbled and he winked his eye
And then we started dancing much to our surprise.
We started mashing, toe tapping, we touched our toes and knees.
And then he growled RAAAW! And then he howled OOOOH. 
And he hopped and shouted FREEZE!
Tip toe, tip toe out of the haunted house we go.
Tip toe, tip toe out of the house we go.
Tip toe, tip toe out of the haunted house we go.
Tip toe, tip toe, make sure you close the door.
SOUND EFFECT- Door closing to a slam!

This fun and familiar song for preschoolers and toddlers can help children get on their feet, get some of their wiggles out, and learn the names of body parts in English. Bright animations and an upbeat tune make this a song you won't want to miss! CAn you keep singing even when the music cuts out?

snippet.title: Partner Brain Break: "Keep Your Head Up"
snippet.description:
Here's the moves we came up with to the "Keep Your Head Up" song by Andy Grammer. So grab a partner and let's get ready to breathe, connect, and rock this brain break!  ♥OPEN FOR MORE♥
____________________________

BACKSTORY: Tired of the traditional Brain Break songs available, my daughter Avery and I set out to create some fun new brain breaks to popular songs that not only get your body moving, but also serve as opportunities for connection and eye contact with peers and adults to help support healthy relationships. These work great as part of a Conscious Discipline "Brain Smart Start" in how they incorporate opportunities to 1- Unite (everyone doing the same actions) 2- Disengage Stress (deep breathing), 3- Connect (hugs and eye contact).  So enjoy the break and have fun connecting with those you love both at school and at home!
____________________________

Intersted in learning more about Conscious Discipline for your home or classroom, click here to learn more: https://consciousdiscipline.com

My Other Conscious Discipline video: "How to Connect with Kids Using I Love You Rituals": https://youtu.be/bl7b3TespAw

____________________________

OTHER PLACES YOU CAN FIND ME:

♥FOLLOW ME ON INSTAGRAM♥
ashleysgreenlife (https://instagram.com/ashleysgreenlife/)


♥SUBSCRIBE TO MY YOUTUBE CHANNEL♥
http://www.youtube.com/subscription_c...

Please leave friendly comments or questions below!
____________________________

Thank you for all your support 
❤Ashley

snippet.title: "Together Again" Fun Brain Break Song for Kids
snippet.description: Hello Everybody. Here is a great song to sing in the morning while students have a lot of energy. This song "Together Again" also shares the expectation of your class that students and teachers will sing and be happy because we're all here together again! I like to sing this song with an accelerando to help students get all of their silly energy out. After clapping, stomping, and patting, you can come up with any type of movement you would like to do. You can even allow students to come up with their own movement or pose. Use this time to help students stretch and gain focus while also acting silly. It is all about finding a balance!

snippet.title: Tooty Ta | Hip Hop Tooty Ta | Tooty Ta Hip Hop | Tooty Ta Song | Brain Breaks | Jack Hartmann
snippet.description:
Tooty Ta is super popular children’s song as part of your “brain breaks” for students to get some fun physical activity, and rejuvenate their body and brain. Children everywhere love Tooty ta!

Hip-Hop Tooty Ta can really help to re-focus student’s attention, get a mental and physical break from their academics  enabling them to have a better focus for learning.  Using my cool 
Hip-Hop Tooty-Ta as a “brain break” is a win-win situation. Students learn during these “brain breaks” plus return to a task renewed and energized.

Classroom and Physical Education teachers as well as home learners can quickly and easily use Tooty Ta to give students fun and energizing brain breaks.

It is important that our children get opportunities throughout the day for movement. My Hip-Hop Tooty Ta has a cool contemporary beat that kids today really love.  Of all the Tooty Ta songs out there, children and teachers all over the country and the world love my version.

Check out some of our Hip-Hop dance moves which are ideal for crossing the mid-line.  It’s also important for your children to hear the alliteration of Tooty Ta to develop their phonological awareness for listening to the sounds in our language.

Repeat a Tooty Ta

Repeat A Tooty Ta

snippet.title: We're Going on a Bear Hunt | Popular Song for Preschoolers | The Kiboomers
snippet.description:
The Kiboomers!  Grab your binoculars, we're going on a bear hunt!  We're Going on a Bear Hunt is a fun action song for kids. It helps introduce prepositions to young children.
★Get this song on iTunes: https://itunes.apple.com/us/album/rea...
Watch our ‘We're Going On A Bear Hunt’ video and sing along with the kids!

'WE'RE GOING ON A BEAR HUNT SONG LYRICS':

We're going on a bear hunt X2
I've got my binoculars X2
I'm not scared X2

Oh, Look at that tall wavy grass
It's so tall

Can't go over it X2
Can't go under it X2
Just going to have to go through it X2
swish swish swish 

We're going on a bear hunt X2
I've got my binoculars X2
I'm not scared X2

Uh oh, there's a big river
Can't go over it X2 
Can't go under it X2 
Going to have to swim it X2
splash splash splash 

We're going on a bear hunt X2
I've got my binoculars X2
I'm not scared X2

Ugh, look at all that mud
so muddy
Can't go over it X2
Can't go under it X2
Going to have to go through it
squish squish squish 

We're going on a bear hunt X2
I've got my binoculars X2
I'm not scared X2

Uh oh, what's that
It's a cave
We can't go over it
We can't go under it
Going to have to go into it
step step step 

We're going on a bear hunt X2
I've got my binoculars X2
I'm not scared 
I'm a little scared

Sure is dark in here
What's that in the corner
I feel 2 big ears X 2
I feel 1 wet nose X 2
I feel 2 sharp teeth X2 
I know what that is
It's a bear

Let's get out of here

Let's run out of the cave
step step step 

Quickly back through the mud
squish squish squish

Let's cross the river
splash splash splash 

Through the tall grass
swish swish swish


Through the yard, up the stairs, into the house, close the door

We're safe

That's a close one

Let's not go bear hunting anymore!

If you like this video, please subscribe to the Kiboomu channel : http://youtube.com/kiboomu

snippet.title: Angry Song 😬 Emotions Song and Feelings Song for Children 😬 Kids Songs by The Learning Station
snippet.description:
Angry Song is from the award-winning CD, “Singing, Moving and Fun” 
“Singing, Moving and Fun” CD Download by The Learning Station (a.k.a. Learning Station) and sung by Don Monopoli. Download “Sing, Moving and Fun CD: http://store.learningstationmusic.com/singingmovingandfundownload.aspx
“Singing, Moving and Fun” CD: http://store.learningstationmusic.com/singingmovingandfun.aspx               Visit The Learning Station: https://www.learningstationmusic.com/
Visit our store!  CD’s, CD Downloads, DVD’s, Tee shirts & more: https://www.learningstationmusic.com/shop/
Angry 
★Lyrics
Angry Song  (This emotions song for children teaches them how to deal with anger.)
From the CD, “Singing, Moving and Fun” 
by The Learning Station  (a.k.a. Learning Station) and sung by Don Monopoli                                                             
℗©Monopoli/The Learning Station 

When I ask my friends to play and they say, “No, just go away.” I’m angry. I feel so angry. 
When I’m standing in a line and someone pushes from behind. I’m angry. I feel so angry. 

It’s okay if you get mad. It’s just because you’re feeling bad. It’s alright to feel that way. 
Just use words and you should say, “I’m angry. I feel so angry.” 

When I’m having lots of fun and Daddy tells me, “ Clean up son. “ I’m angry. I feel so angry. 
Kids tease me and call me “squirt”. My feelings really do get hurt. I’m angry. I feel so angry.
When I build my blocks so high and someone knocks them down, I cry. I’m angry. I feel so angry. 

Cooperation is the way to make the angries go away. So talk, don’t shout. Just work it out, and it’s okay of you should say, “I’m angry. I feel so angry.” “I’m angry. I feel so angry.” “I’m angry. I feel so angry.”
“I’m angry. I feel so angry.” “I’m angry. I feel so angry.” “I’m angry. I feel so angry.” “I’m angry.”

❤ Visit our website for hundreds of your kid’s favorite videos: https://goo.gl/kjTTm4
❤ Check out our “Learning Songs for Kids” complete playlist!: https://goo.gl/2CgGjL

snippet.title: Dance & Freeze | Dance Song for Kids | Jack Hartmann
snippet.description:
Dance and Freeze is a fun music and movement freeze dance song.  This Jack Hartmann freeze dance song will get your children dancing and moving.  It's an upbeat, lively song that will have them dancing and then freezing when the music stops.  This is a great brain breaks movement and freeze dance song. Move and freeze to the rocking beat of this freeze dance song.

LYRICS:

Everybody get up and dance with me
It's our favorite song dance and freeze
Come on let's dance, dance, dance
Feel the beat pump, dance dance dance and freeze
Let's go now dance, dance, dance
Make your body shake, dance, dance, dance and freeze

Everybody dance, dance, dance keep it going now
Dance and freeze
Feel the music, feel the beat
From the top of your head to the bottom of  your feet
Feel the music, feel the beat and freeze
Come on now dance, dance, dance, feeling good now
Dance and freeze
You got it, dance, dance, dance all together 
Dance, dance, dance and freeze

Let's go dance dance dance , make your best move
Dance, dance dance and freeze
Feel the music feel the beat from the top of your head 
To the bottom of your feet
Feel the music feel the beat and freeze
Come on and dance, dance, dance
Feel the beat pump
Dance, dance, dance and freeze

snippet.title: Subitize Rock (soo-bi-tize) | Math Song for Kids | Jack Hartmann
snippet.description:
Subitize to 10. Subitize is the ability to tell the number of objects in a set, quickly, without counting.  Subitizing develops math fluency, when students recognize sets without having to count each object and it helps develop number sense and the ability to perform mental math. Name the numbers in each set of dots, ten frames and fingers. This version  of Subitize Rock does not show the numerals after each set.

Lyrics
Subitize, subitize
Use your brain
Use your eyes
See a set, then think quick
Say the number in the set

(Say the number of dots in each set)

Subitize, subitize
Use your brain
Use your eyes
See a set, then think quick
Say the number in the set

(Say the number in the ten frames)

Subitize, subitize
Use your brain
Use your eyes
See a set, then think quick
Say the number in the set

(Say the number of fingers)

Subitize, subitize
Use your brain
Use your eyes
See a set, then think quick
Say the number in the set

snippet.title: Goin' On A Treasure Hunt | Brain & Body Builder | Brain Breaks | Fun Kid's Song | Jack Hartmann
snippet.description:
Going On a Treasure Hunt  focuses on positional and math vocabulary words as the children go on an entertaining 
treasure hunt through the jungle searching for pirates’ treasure.
Going On a Treasure Hunt  builds on a growing pattern where students apply listening and auditory skills, such as
 discriminating sounds and associating concepts, actions,
 and ideas with expressive language. This is a fun adaptation of Going on a Bear Hunt.  
Just have fun with this adventure.Help children be aware of the sequence of places & situations. Drawing pictures about this adventure would be fun - then put the drawings in the right order.

LYRICS:
Going On A Treasure Hunt 
  
Girls and boys come join me on an awesome adventure 
As we hunt in the jungle for pirates treasure
 Put on your jungle boots - shoop, shoop
 Put on your jungle hats - plop, plop, plop
 Now, your cool jungle sunglasses - cool 
Alright, mon - let’s go! 

 Chorus
 Goin’ on a treasure hunt ...
 Stompin’ through the jungle ...
 Lookin’ out for pirates ... and we’re not afraid ... 
(Children follow story - act out action words)
 Look straight ahead ... it’s a giant jungle
 It’s too far to walk ... get in the jungle jeep 
And ride! Oh, it’s bumpy! Very bumpy - ah, ah - oh - 
 
 Goin’ on a treasure hunt ...
 Stompin’ thru the jungle ...
 Lookin’ out for pirates ... and we’re not afraid ... 
(Children follow story - act out action words)
 Look straight ahead ... it’s a giant jungle
 It’s too far to walk ... get in the jungle jeep 
And ride! Oh, it’s bumpy! Very bumpy - ah, ah - oh - 
 
“Look down below” ... it’s Creepy Creek 
 
 Goin’ on a treasure hunt ...
 Stompin’ thru the jungle ...
 Lookin’ out for pirates ... and we’re not afraid ... 
(Children follow story - act out action words)
 Look straight ahead ... it’s a giant jungle
 It’s too far to walk ... get in the jungle jeep 
And ride! Oh, it’s bumpy! Very bumpy - ah, ah - oh - 
 
“Look to the right” ... it’s a field of lions sleeping ... 
 
 Goin’ on a treasure hunt ...
 Stompin’ thru the jungle ...
 Lookin’ out for pirates ... and we’re not afraid ... 
(Children follow story - act out action words)
 Look straight ahead ... it’s a giant jungle
 It’s too far to walk ... get in the jungle jeep 
And ride! Oh, it’s bumpy! Very bumpy - ah, ah - oh -  
 
“Look to the left” ... it’s a tunnel ... 
Something’s jing-jangling ... under my feet ...
 It’s the treasure ... 
There’s a tap on my back ... 
Aye Matey, I see you found my treasure... 
Do you know whose treasure it is-?
Whew back to the jungle shack ...
 We went on a treasure hunt ... And we weren’t afraid!

snippet.title: Silly Rockstar Song | Brain Break | Jack Hartmann
snippet.description:
Silly Rock Star is a growing pattern song with lots of Rock Star characters.  Remember their lines and move along with each Rock Star Character as they sing and move along with Rock Star Jack Hartmann.  Act out the parts of the rapper, cheerleaders, cowboy, astronaut, chicken, princess and pirate in Jack Hartmann's original Silly Rockstar Song. 

Lyrics
Once there was a rock star who sang a rock song
Along came a rapper who sang a different song
You'd hear Rock, rock, roll, roll, boom, boom
Yo, yo, yo, hey dog that sounds pretty cool

Once there was a rock star who sang a rock song
Along came cheerleaders who sang a different song
You'd hear Rock, rock, roll, roll, boom, boom
Clap your hands, stomp your feet, our school can't be bear
Yo, yo, yo, hey dog that sounds pretty cool

Once there was a rock star who sang a rock song
Along came a cowboy who sang a different song
You'd hear Rock, rock, roll, roll, boom, boom
Yippee I yay, yippee I yo
Clap your hands, stomp your feet, our school can't be bear
Yo, yo, yo, hey dog that sounds pretty cool

Once there was a rock star who sang a rock song
Along came an astronaut who sang a different song
You'd hear Rock, rock, roll, roll, boom, boom
3-2-1 Blastoff!
Yippee I yay, yippee I yo
Clap your hands, stomp your feet, our school can't be bear
Yo, yo, yo, hey dog that sounds pretty cool

Once there was a rock star who sang a rock song
Along came a chicken who sang a different song
You'd hear Rock, rock, roll, roll, boom, boom
Buck, buck, buck, buck, buck
3-2-1 Blastoff!
Yippee I yay, yippee I yo
Clap your hands, stomp your feet, our school can't be bear
Yo, yo, yo, hey dog that sounds pretty cool

Once there was a rock star who sang a rock song
Along came a princess who sang a different song
You'd hear Rock, rock, roll, roll, boom, boom
Do the Egyptian, dance, dance
Buck, buck, buck, buck, buck
3-2-1 Blastoff!
Yippee I yay, yippee I yo
Clap your hands, stomp your feet, our school can't be bear
Yo, yo, yo, hey dog that sounds pretty cool

Once there was a rock star who sang a rock song
Along came a pirate who sang a different song
You'd hear Rock, rock, roll, roll, boom, boom
Yo ho, yo ho, arrgghh!
Do the Egyptian, dance, dance
Buck, buck, buck, buck, buck
3-2-1 Blastoff!
Yippee I yay, yippee I yo
Clap your hands, stomp your feet, our school can't be bear
Yo, yo, yo, hey dog that sounds pretty cool

They all gave a high five and said 
Respect man
Let's get together and make a new band

snippet.title: Name the Shape Game  | Shape Review Game | Jack Hartmann
snippet.description:
Name the Shape Game makes naming shapes fun in this game show format.  Jack Hartmann shows the shape and asks students to identify the shape, before he name the shape the first three times.  The last time students are asked to name the shape all on their own.  We show shapes as both illustrations and shapes in our environment. Recognizing everyday shapes in our environment is an important part of application of knowledge in identifying shapes.  Have fun and learn your shapes in this fun Name the Shape Game video.

snippet.title: Make a Rhyme Make a Move | Rhyming Song for Kids | Jack Hartmann
snippet.description:
Help your children develop their phonological awareness (hearing the parts in words) and rhyming skills with this cool rhyming song that engages your children with movement, dance, and most importantly an opportunity to practice their awareness of words that rhyme. This song really makes rhyming fun which is so important in learning for young children. The ability to know when words rhyme is an essential listening and language skill for all children.  Many studies have shown that children who have developed their ability to know when words rhyme will have a better chance of becoming successful readers. Offering your children many opportunities to hear and practice rhyming will give them a better chance of becoming lifelong readers.
Make a Rhyme, Make a Move is a great song to use regularly to allow your children to really have   fun learning about rhyming.  This song presents two words, and children have a chance to listen and decide if the words rhyme or not. If the words rhyme then they do a cool Hip –Hop dance, and if the words don’t rhyme they get a chance to move and say - No way, no way.
 Listening for the parts of sounds in words at the beginning, middle and ending really helps children develop their phonological awareness (hearing the parts of words) skills so important in becoming a successful reader.
This song is so cool it will really help make learning about rhyming fun for all your children.
 Make a Rhyme, Make a Move includes Jack Hartmann and Rachel Smith singing together. Both Rachel and Jack show your children the different moves and dances they can do. And, this rhyming song features rhyming that is simple and easy to follow.
Studies show that having the ability to recognize and be aware of words that rhyme is a good predictor of future successful reading in the future.
Help make rhyming fun for your children and sing, dance and listen for those rhymes!

Lyrics:

Make a rhyme, make a move 
You can do it 
 I can too 
Let's go! 

Make a rhyme, make a move
Do it to the beat
Make a rhyme, make a move 
Have some fun with me  

When the two words rhyme make a move like this 
Two thumbs up, crisscross
Say that rhymes
That rhymes 
When the words don’t rhyme
Make a move like this 
One arm out front, back and forth 
Say no way
No way  
You got it 

cat - hat   
That rhymes 
dog – frog   
That rhymes  
can – mat 
No way 
Pig – jig   
That rhymes (2x) 
Boat – car 
No way  (2x)
Silly – Willy   
That rhymes (2x)

Make a rhyme, make a move 
You can do it 
 I can too 
Let's go! 

Make a rhyme, make a move
Do it to the beat
Make a rhyme, make a move 
Have some fun with me  

Bug – hug  
That rhymes (2x) 
Teacher – preacher  
That rhymes (2x) 
House – truck 
No way (2x)
House – mouse  
That rhymes (2x)
Tree – me  
That rhymes (2x) 
Egg – chicken   
No way (2x)

snippet.title: Brand New Day | Brain Breaks | Jack Hartmann
snippet.description:
Brand New Day is fun, good morning and start the day song.  This is a fun call and response song with lots of movement.  This song is a terrific way to start the day, recognize and move body parts to get ready for the day. Good morning song for kids.


LYRICS:

 – It’s a Brand New Day 
 
Activity – Start the day with this fun movement, call & response song for all ages.  Move hands, swing arms, sway hips, both hands over heart, twist feet, pat knees, touch toes  and nose and create your own movements. 

LYRICS:
 
I can feel it in my hands…………In my hands
 I can feel it in my arms…………In my arms
 I can feel it in my hips………….In my hips
 I can feel it in my heart…..…….In my heart 
 
I can feel it in my feet…………..In my feet
 I can feel it in my knees….…….In my knees
 I can feel it in my toes………….In my toes
 I can feel it in my nose……...….In my nose  
I can feel it!  
(Chorus)  It’s a brand new day (Repeat 4X) 
 
Now, I can feel it in my shoulders...In my shoulders
 I can feel it in my ears……………..In my ears
 I can feel it in my eyes……………..In my eyes
 I can feel it in my smile…………….In my smile  
I can feel it way up high………..…..Way up high
 I can feel it in the sky…………….…In the sky
 I can feel it way down low………….Way down low
 I can feel it as I grow………………..As I grow

snippet.title: Move it and Freeze Extended | Brain Breaks | Jack Hartmann
snippet.description:
Move it and Freeze with Jack Hartmann.  Jack shows lots of fun movements and then listen carefully for when Jack says freeze.  Great for auditory discrimination and careful listening skills for building bodies and brains.  Move it and freeze also incorporates plenty of cross lateral movements for crossing the mid-line.  Have fun dance and freeze. This extended version has Jack moving and freezing with Humpty Dumpty and a chicken friend.

Lyrics
Move it, move it , move it and freeze
Move it, move it , move it and freeze
Reach both hands high,  sway them side to side
Crossover, crossover to the left and right
Move it, move it , move it and freeze
Move it, move it , move it and freeze

Put your hands in fists, roll them side to side
Crossover, crossover to the left and right
Move it, move it , move it and freeze
Move it, move it , move it and freeze

Spread your feet to the sides, get set to jump high
Crisscross, crisscross to the left and right
Move it, move it , move it and freeze
Move it, move it , move it and freeze

Move it like Humpty Dumpty dancing on the wall
Twisting and turning please Humpty don't fall
Move it like a chicken shaking his wings and knees
Move it, move it , move it and freeze

Move your arms out straight, swing your hips side to side
Switcharoo, switcharoo floss dance left and right
Move it, move it , move it and freeze
Move it, move it , move it and freeze

I like to move it with my hands and move it with my feet
I like to move it with my friends feel so good and so free
Move it down low, move it up high
I like to crisscross, crisscross left and right
Move it, move it , move it and freeze
Move it, move it , move it and freeze

snippet.description:
I Can Move My Body Like Anything is a fun music and movement brain breaks song for kids.  Move your body with fun dances, shake like a salt shaker, roll like a roller coaster, pop like popcorn, wave like the ocean, flip like a pancake, bounce like a basketball,  twirl like a dancer, clean it like a vacuum cleaner, spread it like peanut butter, 
bloom like a flower and sparkle like a star in this movement song for kids.  There is motion and movement all around us in our environment. Perform creative movement in a specific order.
